meanings.definition: In a stubborn or unyielding manner.
meanings.sent1: She obdurately refused to try the new food.
meanings.sent2: He walked obdurately towards the finish line, ignoring the pain.
meanings.sent3: The cat obdurately sat in the middle of the doorway, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood obdurately against the strong winds, its roots firmly planted.
meanings.sent5: The child obdurately insisted on wearing mismatched socks every day.

meanings.definition: Showing a refusal to change one's opinion or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The obdurately stubborn man wouldn't listen to any advice.
meanings.sent2: Her obdurately fixed gaze showed her determination.
meanings.sent3: The obdurately persistent squirrel kept trying to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The obdurately closed door symbolized the end of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: His obdurately set mind made it hard for him to accept new ideas.
